metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9659 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
cff/cf2intrp.c in the CFF CharString interpreter in FreeType before 2.5.4proceeds with additional hints after the hint mask has been computed, whichallows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial ofservice (stack-based buffer overflow) via a crafted OpenType font.  NOTE:this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-2240.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9659` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freetype2-demos - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
libfreetype6 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freetype package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4').
